q: GST audit was mandatory under section 35(5).
GST audit requirement has been removed from 2021.
GSTR-9C is now self-certified reconciliation statement.
Turnover threshold for GSTR-9C is Rs. ______ crore.
Department audit is conducted under section 65.
Department audit is by officer not below rank of Assistant Commissioner.
Audit period is one financial year or multiple years.
Advance notice of ______ days is required for audit.
Audit must be completed within ______ months.
Special audit is ordered by Commissioner.
Special audit is by CA or CMA nominated by Commissioner.
Special audit cost is borne by Commissioner.
Tax liability is self-determined by taxpayer.
Payment is made based on self-assessment.
Provisional assessment is for uncertain valuation.
Bond amount is up to tax and interest.
Final assessment within ______ months of provisional.
Scrutiny is checking of returns by officer.
Scrutiny notice is in form ASMT-10.
Taxpayer response is in form ASMT-11.
Scrutiny closing is in form ASMT-12.
Best judgment assessment is under section 62.
ASMT-13 is best judgment assessment order.
Best judgment can be withdrawn on filing returns.
Summary assessment is in exceptional cases.
Demand and recovery is under section 73 and 74.
Show cause notice is in form DRC-01.
Pre-SCN intimation is in form DRC-01A.
Demand order is in form DRC-07.
Payment within 30 days of SCN reduces penalty.
Appeal to first appellate authority is within ______ months.
First appellate authority is Joint/Additional Commissioner.
Pre-deposit for first appeal is ______ percent.
Condonation of delay is possible up to ______ month.
GSTAT stands for GST Appellate Tribunal.
GSTAT appeal is within ______ months of first appeal order.
Additional pre-deposit for GSTAT is ______ percent.
High Court appeal is for substantial question of law.
Supreme Court appeal is from High Court.
Direct appeal to Supreme Court in certain cases.
Review petition is available for factual errors.
Revision under section 108 is by Commissioner.
Advance ruling is by Authority for Advance Ruling.
AAR consists of one member from CGST and one from SGST.
Advance ruling application fee is Rs. ______.
Advance ruling is binding on applicant and department.
Appeal against advance ruling is to AAAR.
AAAR stands for Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling.
AAAR decision is final at state level.
High Court can be approached against AAAR.
Search and seizure is under section 67.
Joint Commissioner or above can authorize search.
Arrest for cognizable offence above Rs. ______ crore.
Bail is available as per CrPC.
Compounding is available for most offences.
Detention is for goods in transit.
Release is on payment of tax and penalty.
Penalty for detention is equal to ______ percent of tax.
If owner comes forward, penalty is ______ percent of tax.
If owner does not come forward, penalty is higher.
Perishable goods can be disposed if not released.
What is the limitation period for section 73?
What is the limitation period for section 74?
Delay condonation for first appeal is:
Form for show cause notice is:
Form for best judgment assessment is:
Anti-profiteering ensures benefit pass to consumer.
NAA functions transferred to CCI from 2022.
CCI is Competition Commission of India.
Penalty for anti-profiteering includes refund to consumer.
Consumer welfare fund receives if consumer unidentified.
Registration cancellation is possible for profiteering.
Penalty can be up to value of profiteered amount.
Interest is charged on profiteered amount.
GST Council is chaired by Union Finance Minister.
GST Council decisions are by ______ percent majority.
Centre has ______ percent vote in GST Council.
First two characters are state code.
E-way bill is for movement above Rs. ______ value.
E-way bill validity depends on distance.
E-way bill can be extended before expiry.
IRN is unique Invoice Reference Number.
QR code is mandatory on e-invoice.
Dynamic QR is for B2C invoices.
Input tax credit is under section 16.
ITC requires return filing by supplier.
Motor vehicles are generally blocked credit.
Food and beverages are blocked credit.
Works contract for immovable property is blocked.
GSTR-2B shows ITC available for claim.
Mismatch in ITC may trigger scrutiny.
ITC claim cannot exceed GSTR-2B by more than ______ percent.
Rule 86B restricts ITC use for certain taxpayers.
Rule 86B applies if taxable value exceeds Rs. ______ lakh.
Job work provisions are in section 143.
Job work is supply of services.
Goods must return within ______ year for job work.
Capital goods return period is ______ years.
ISD cannot distribute credit for goods.
Inter-state supply to own branch is taxable.
Stock transfer between states attracts IGST.
Branch transfer ITC is available to receiving branch.
Interest on delayed refund is ______ percent.
Recovery modes include adjustment from refund.
Installment payment is available for admitted dues.
Interest is paid from cash ledger only.
Late fee is calculated per day.
Late fee is capped for NIL returns.
Penalty under section 122 is for contraventions.
General penalty under section 125 is Rs. ______.
Penalty can be equal to tax evaded.
Compounding is not available for repeat offenders.
Compounding amount is higher than penalty.
Application for compounding is to Commissioner.
What section covers best judgment assessment?
What section covers inspection and search?
What section covers demand for normal cases?
What section covers demand for fraud cases?
First appeal provisions are in which sections?
GSTAT provisions are in which sections?
Advance ruling is in which sections?
GSTR-9C has Part A and Part B.
Part A is reconciliation of turnover and tax.
GSTR-9 is summary of monthly returns.
GSTR-9 is mandatory for turnover above Rs. ______ crore.
What is the form for assessment order under section 62?
Taxpayer can withdraw best judgment by filing return within ______ days.
Withdrawal of best judgment assessment is in form ASMT-14.
Personal hearing is mandatory before adverse order.
Adjournment of hearing is possible on request.
Time limit for passing order under section 73 from SCN is ______ months.
Time limit for passing order under section 74 from SCN is ______ months.
Limitation is from due date of annual return filing.
Extension of limitation requires specific reasons.
COVID period exclusion from limitation was done.
Rectification time is ______ months from order date.
Personal hearing before rectification if adverse.
Revision cannot increase liability without opportunity.
Appeal to Appellate Authority stays recovery.
Pre-deposit stays recovery for that portion.
Balance demand may be stayed on application.
Stay application is considered by appellate authority.
Request for cross-examination must be made.
Denial of cross-examination may vitiate order.
Section 16 conditions for ITC are subject to audit verification.
ITC verification includes supplier return filing.
Transitional credit issues are common audit finding.
TRAN-2 was for stock transfer credit.
Transition credit claims are subject to verification.
Place of supply errors are audit findings.
Wrong tax type (IGST vs CGST+SGST) is common error.
Place of supply for services to B2B is recipient location.
Place of supply for goods is movement based.
Correction of tax type requires amendment.
RCM lapses are common audit finding.
RCM on notified goods requires self-assessment.
RCM on notified services requires self-assessment.
RCM ITC is available if conditions met.
Related party transactions require open market value.
Valuation rules are in chapter IV of rules.
E-way bill compliance is verified in audit.
Missing e-way bill for movement is violation.
E-way bill value mismatch is issue.
E-way bill expiry during transit is violation.
E-way bill cancellation for fictitious transactions.
Credit note issues are audit findings.
Credit note time limit is September of next year.
Recipient must reverse ITC for credit note.
Credit note without supply reduction is incorrect.
Exemption claims are verified in audit.
Exemption notification conditions must be met.
Returns reconciliation is key audit procedure.
HSN code errors are audit findings.
HSN code depth depends on turnover.
4-digit HSN for turnover up to Rs. 5 crore.
6-digit HSN for turnover above Rs. 5 crore.
Data analytics is used in departmental audit.
What is penalty for not registering?
What is penalty for wrong invoice?
What is penalty for not maintaining records?
What is penalty for transporting without documents?
What is penalty for obstructing officer?
What is penalty for not furnishing information?
What is penalty for false statement?
What is penalty for aiding evasion?
Audit objections must be disposed within ______ months.
Audit may convert to investigation for serious cases.
Audit findings may lead to demand proceedings.
Voluntary payment during audit is beneficial.
Summons can be issued during investigation.
Statement on oath can be recorded.
Raid is search operation under section 67.
Authorization is by Joint Commissioner or above.
Raid can be on premises including residence.
Panchnama is record of raid proceedings.
Bail provisions depend on offence amount.
Writ is for violation of fundamental rights.
Writ is faster remedy than appeal.
Beneficial circular can be relied upon.
Circular contrary to law is invalid.
Effective date is specified in notification.
Document retention is ______ years plus 1 year of appeal.
Books of accounts must be maintained.
Proper officer is assigned based on GSTIN.
Jurisdiction is divided between centre and state.
What form is used for reply to SCN?
What form is used for summary of order?
What form is used for appeal to Appellate Authority?
What form is used for appeal acknowledgment?
What form is used for appeal memorandum to GSTAT?
What form is used for provisional refund?
What form is used for final refund order?
What form is for advance ruling application?
What form is for advance ruling appeal?
What form is for voluntary payment?
Assessment of return is deemed acceptance after time limit.
Deemed acceptance can be reopened if fraud found.
Limitation period protects from indefinite assessment.
Extended period applies only for fraud/suppression.
Burden of proving fraud is on department.
What is the appeal time limit for first appeal?
What is the appeal time limit for GSTAT?
What is the appeal time limit for High Court?
What is the delay condonation for first appeal?
What is the delay condonation for GSTAT?
Cross-reference between CGST and IGST provisions exists.
IGST Act imports provisions from CGST Act.
Assessment and audit provisions apply to IGST.
What is the section for inspection of goods in movement?
What is the section for access to business premises?
What is the section for officers to assist proper officers?
What is the section for liability of partners?
What is the section for liability of directors?
What is the section for liability of guardians?
What is the section for liability of court?
What is the section for liability of agents?
Audit findings must be communicated clearly.
Taxpayer has right to object to audit findings.
Agreed findings may be settled during audit.
Unagreed findings proceed to demand stage.
Audit report is submitted at conclusion.
Tax avoidance is aggressive but legal.
GAAR may apply to aggressive avoidance.
Audit looks for substance over form.
Invoice number sequence gaps trigger query.
Invoice date and supply date must match.
Zero-rated supply must have proper documentation.
LUT must be valid for zero-rating.
Composition dealer cannot have inter-state supply.
Composition dealer ITC claim is violation.
Composition dealer invoice format is different.
TCS compliance is audited for e-commerce.
ISD can only distribute services ITC.
Annual return reconciliation is key audit area.
GSTR-9 tables are verified against books.
What penalty applies for not cooperating with audit?
What penalty applies for not producing documents?
What penalty applies for not attending summons?
What penalty applies for destroying evidence?
What penalty applies for tampering with computers?
Post-SCN payment within 30 days has benefit.
Section 73 penalty reduces if paid before order.
Section 74 penalty reduces if paid within 30 days.
Penalty waiver is possible in genuine cases.
ITC based on fake invoice is fraudulent.
Supply chain verification for fake invoices.
DGGI is Directorate General of GST Intelligence.
State SGST has parallel investigation powers.
Coordination between CGST and SGST for investigation.
What form is used for intimation of discrepancy?
What form is used for dropping scrutiny?
What form is used for recovery order?
What form is used for recovery certificate?
What form is used for communication of recovery details?
Audit may be extended beyond 3 months with approval.
Reasons for extension must be recorded.
Total audit period cannot exceed 9 months.
Input mismatch with output is audit red flag.
Service provider audit checks place of supply.
Service tax to GST transition verified.
RCM on import of services checked.
ITC of capital goods is verified for apportionment.
Capital goods ITC is full if used exclusively for taxable.
Common capital goods ITC is apportioned.
Reversal on capital goods disposed is checked.
